newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to offer Merchant Server Software.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to offer Merchant Server Software.

text.p: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday said it would offer a software package, Merchant Server 1.0, that will make it easier for companies to sell goods over the Internet.
Merchant Server enables companies to establish selling sites on the Internet's World Wide Web with minimal development costs, Microsoft said.
It offers customers a secure buying experience and helps generate sales through targeted dynamic sales promotions, it said.
The software is set for release by December 1.
The firm said server licenses will be available for the full package price of $14,995, and administration licenses, required to host a live domain, are available for $3,495.
Companies that host their own Web sites can develop online selling with Merchant Server for a total licensing price of $18,490.
Microsoft said it has already developed Merchant Server-based relationships with numerous firms that operate on the Internet, from Internet service providers to retailers.
In a statement, Bill Gates, Microsoft chief executive and chairman, said, "Microsoft is committed to enabling all types of Internet commerce..."
